Header: 120 billion rupees will be allocated for drugs in government hospitals this year
Content: Minister Pavithra Wanniarachchi says that 120 billion rupees will be allocated for drugs in government hospitals this year. The Health Minister made this reference following an inspection tour of the Maharagama Apeksha Hospital. The Minister inquired into the medicines needed for the patients in the hospital as well as the facilities provided to the patients.The Minister further stated that funds have already been provided for the patients to obtain the required drugs at the Apeksha Hospital. Minister Pavithra Wanniarachchi mentioned that when the Ministry was taken over by them, 12 billion rupees had to be paid for various companies as arrears. It has been estimated to grant 120 billion rupees for Government Hospitals from the budget for various types of drugs. The vision of the present Government is to create an environment for patients who enter hospitals to leave happily and with a good mentality.
